reviews.review_msg: steve's a nice guy, & is really into the material. He's a pretty demanding marker, but gives a lot of detailed direction and pointers on how to write a paper. He was way more prepared in the tutorial i took than the other reviews here, though he isn't very consistent w/ office hours.

Scott is the least favorite ta i have ever had. I recommend avoiding him if possible. He has a large ego that he uses to make you feel bad. He spent 1.5 hrs total this semester telling us how lazy we all were and how we were screwed for our futures bc we dont read 9 hrs a week per class which is what he unrealistically thinks we should be doing. He is a tough marker so make sure you work hard. Overall, arrogant, rude and obnoxious best describe scott.
I have the biggest brain-crush on both Gary and Scott. I will be on the look out for classes they teach next Fall.

Scott's not as bad as he seems. High expectations and not shy about insulting your inevitable laziness and lack of intelligence, but if you're THAT wounded by it then your ego is too fragile anyways. Always willing to help, and though you will be too scared to ask for it, he'll likely end up telling you some interesting/useful things anyways.

I can't stand reading the complaining of other students who refused to so much as read for this class and then expect to have high marks doled out. This TA makes you work but surprise it's a 3rd year course!
He wants you to think and geez, well you are in university, hmmm.  A bit biased to the left I think but overall, you learn a lot from him.  Not a class you can coast by.
Gary's lectures were outstanding. Grading was fair and course topics were super interesting. Loved this class and would highly recommend him as a prof.

Clearly very passionate about communications & philosophy which made the class so much better. It was obvious that he wasn't used to teaching online but made the lectures engaging and interesting. I knew nothing about philosophy before taking the course but by doing the readings and paying attention you will do fine! Overall a great prof!

Gary is a very knowledgeable professor when it comes to rhetoric. The class topics are difficult to grasp, very heavy on philosophical theories, but if you put in work, shouldnt be too unmanageable. The weekly responses are too much work for only 2 marks. His lectures are very boring and dry, but he is a nice guy. Wouldnt say hes an amazing prof

At the beginning of the semester I was worried about Gary's class because it was pretty reading-heavy & the topics were hard to grasp, but Gary's lectures were really helpful and pretty interesting! He also responded to all of my emails really quickly and provided a ton of resources to help with my term paper. Would definitely take his class again

Rhetoric was by no means an easy class, but that is not to say it wasn't interesting. I was really scared of the philosophical aspect in the first few weeks, but then things got interesting when you learn about the usage of rhetoric in real life.

VERY difficult class, but the prof is amazing. If you don't have to take 332, don't take it. I only took it cause I loved 110 with him, and I regret it. The mid term was extremely difficult and the whole philosophical aspect of the class was too much.
It's a hard course! Must go to class and listen and take your own notes! MT is hard.
Gary's great. Challenging class but lectures were really interesting. You'll need to invest some time into this course if you want to do well, but it's worth taking.
A great teacher and an even better thinker. Watching Gary's mind work was a treat. However, if you're not willing to think hard, then this guy isn't for you.

Excellent professor. Has high expectations and makes the students work for their marks, but is extremely clear, engaging and knowledgeable about her subject. More than anything, Kathi actually cares about her students. Highly recommend taking a course with her.
He's a pretty nice guy just a tough marker. He's a huge fan of quotes, so if you want to do well quote lots
AWESOME!!! He is a GREAT professor! TAKE HIS CLASSES!!!
